top_categories.workout_context: 11,300ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Race-pace efforts that mimic UCI Gravel Suisse's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before July.
UCI Gravel Suisse's 50% paved / 50% unpaved alpine terrain. Starts forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 68 miles.
At UCI Gravel Suisse, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
68 miles on 50% paved / 50% unpaved alpine terrain. Starts burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
166ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
11,300ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At UCI Gravel Suisse, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of UCI Gravel Suisse. Train it until it feels boring.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on 50% paved / 50% unpaved alpine terrain. Starts. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Base fitness for UCI Gravel Suisse. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Low-cadence force work for 11,300ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.heat: July in Aigle / Villars-sur-Ollon, Switzerland can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before UCI Gravel Suisse. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for UCI Gravel Suisse’s 68 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at UCI Gravel Suisse. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at UCI Gravel Suisse requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on 50% paved / 50% unpaved alpine terrain. starts flat in rhone valley, transitions to steep forest climbs and high-altitude gravel roads. features a brutal 20% gradient section on route des chaux before the col de la croix finish to build confidence.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on VO2max, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 68 miles of 50% paved / 50% unpaved alpine terrain. starts flat in rhone valley, transitions to steep forest climbs and high-altitude gravel roads. features a brutal 20% gradient section on route des chaux before the col de la croix finish in Aigle / Villars-sur-Ollon, Switzerland.
